content:
# All Available Tools

## ğŸ“ File Operations
- **read** â€” Read file contents (text files, images)
- **write** â€” Create or overwrite files
- **edit** â€” Make precise edits to existing files

## ğŸ–¥ï¸ Command Execution
- **exec** â€” Run shell commands (with pty support for interactive CLIs)
- **process** â€” Manage background exec sessions (list, poll, write, kill)

## ğŸŒ Web & Browser
- **web_search** â€” Search the web via Brave API
- **web_fetch** â€” Fetch and extract readable content from URLs (HTML â†’ markdown)
- **browser** â€” Control web browser (navigate, screenshot, automate interactions)

## ğŸ§  Memory & Sessions
- **memory_search** â€” Semantically search MEMORY.md + memory/*.md
- **memory_get** â€” Read specific snippets from memory files
- **sessions_list** â€” List other sessions with filters
- **sessions_history** â€” Fetch history from another session
- **sessions_send** â€” Send message to another session
- **sessions_spawn** â€” Spawn a background sub-agent for complex tasks
- **agents_list** â€” List available agent IDs for spawning

## ğŸ“Š Status & Management
- **session_status** â€” Show usage stats, model info, time, cost
- **gateway** â€” Restart, update, or apply config to OpenClaw

## ğŸ’¬ Messaging & Communication
- **message** â€” Send messages, manage channels (Discord, Telegram, WhatsApp, Signal, etc.)
- **tts** â€” Convert text to speech

## ğŸ¨ Canvas & Visualization
- **canvas** â€” Present/eval/snapshot the Canvas (visual UI rendering)

## ğŸ“± Device Control
- **nodes** â€” Control paired devices (notify, camera, screen record, location, run commands)

## â° Scheduling
- **cron** â€” Manage cron jobs and wake events (scheduled tasks, reminders)

## ğŸ–¼ï¸ Vision
- **image** â€” Analyze images with vision models

---

**Total:** 22 core tools covering file management, execution, web research, memory, multi-session orchestration, messaging, device control, scheduling, and more.

Most tasks can be handled directly. For complex multi-step work, I can spawn sub-agents to work in parallel.
